jd: From: Anju Pathak, Tek Inspirations LLC anju.pathak@tekinspirations.com Reply to: anju.pathak@tekinspirations.com PLEASE SEND ME RESUME THOSE CANDIADTES WHO ARE FINE WITH ONSITE NTERVIEW AND LOCAL TO NEW YORK OR NEAR BY NEW YORK.Job Description -Please submit only genuine candidates who can take a 20-minute technical screening call with prime vendor. We previously submitted three candidates who were caught lip-syncing during the call. Agile Business Analyst/Product Analyst2ND ROUND WILL BE F2F. location -4 Irving Place, New York, New York, United States of America, 10003HYBRID (LOCALS ONLY)All candidates must do a video internal tech screening with our colleague and be able to pass prior to submittal to CON EDISON.LinkedIn is must !Job Description:Position Summary: We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Product Analyst (Agile Business Analyst) to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring that our agile E-mobility incentive projects align with business goals and deliver maximum value.Key Responsibilities: Requirements Documentation: Collaborate with stakeholders to assist in gathering and own documenting business requirements, ensuring clarity and completeness.User Stories: Create and refine user stories, acceptance criteria, and ensure they are well-understood by the development teamAgile Facilitation: Support agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, daily stand-ups, reviews, and retrospectivesBacklog Management: Assist in prioritizing the product backlog, ensuring alignment with business objectives and stakeholder needsProcess Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and recommend solutions to enhance efficiency and productivityStakeholder Communication: Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and the development team, facilitating effective communication and collaborationData Analysis: Analyze data to provide insights and support decision-making processesQuality Assurance: Assist in defining and executing test plans to ensure deliverables meet quality standards and business requirements Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Information Technology, or a related field3+ years of experience as a Product Analyst/Business Analyst/Scrum Master in an agile environmentStrong understanding of agile methodologies (e.g., Scrum, Kanban)Excellent communication and interpersonal skillsProficiency in agile tools (e.g., Azure DevOps)Strong analytical and problem-solving abilitiesAbility to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environmentExperience with data analysis and visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI)Certification in Agile methodologies (e.g., Certified Scrum Master, PMI-ACP)Knowledge of software development lifecycle (SDLC)Knowledge of E-mobility and electric vehicle charger programs a plus
